events.title: Italian Renaissance Collection
events.description: How did artists respond to the culture and ideas of the Renaissance in Italy?Join us in exploring the rise of humanism in society and innovations in art through works by artists like Giotto, Leonardo

events.title: (Re)Discover the National Gallery of Art
events.description: Whether this is your first time discovering the National Gallery or we are welcoming you back, this free tour is for you!

events.title: French Sculpture
events.description: Explore 19th century French sculptures from the National Gallery’s collection, including groundbreaking bronzes and marble sculptures by Rodin and rare wax figures by Degas such as Little Dancer Aged

events.title: American Stories
events.description: Join us as we look closely at American art from the colonial period to the early 20th century, engaging in conversation and exploring different perspectives with these works from our collection.

events.title: Exhibition Tour—Civil Rights in Photography and the Black Arts Movement
events.description: Join us for a tour of Photography and the Black Arts Movement as seen through the lens of the struggle for civil rights in the 1960s.

events.title: Glimpses of Life in 17th Century Dutch Art
events.description: Join us to explore works of art that offer glimpses of life in 17th century Dutch society during a period of social, economic, and religious change.

events.title: Italian Renaissance Collection

events.title: (Re)Discover the National Gallery of Art
events.description: Whether this is your first time discovering the National Gallery or we are welcoming you back, this free tour is for you!

events.title: Exhibition Tour—Back and Forth: Rozeal., Titian, Cezanne
events.description: Join us for an interactive conversation about Back and Forth: Rozeal., Titian, Cezanne.

events.title: Glimpses of Life in 17th Century Dutch Art
events.description: Join us to explore works of art that offer glimpses of life in 17th century Dutch society during a period of social, economic, and religious change.

events.title: Italian Renaissance Collection
events.description: How did artists respond to the culture and ideas of the Renaissance in Italy?Join us in exploring the rise of humanism in society and innovations in art through works by artists like Giotto, Leonardo

events.title: (Re)Discover the National Gallery of Art
events.description: Whether this is your first time discovering the National Gallery or we are welcoming you back, this free tour is for you!

events.title: American Icon: The US Flag in Art
events.description: Approximately 30 works from the late 1800s to today will illustrate changing uses and interpretations of the US flag, the values it represents, and the people who identify with it.

events.title: Beneath the Surface
events.description: Nearly two centuries of American photographs transport us to unexpected places to witness what powers our lives.

events.title: Niagara Falls: Mist and Majesty
events.description: Some 20 works will probe how the layered histories and meanings of Niagara Falls—long associated with our country’s nationhood—have evolved from the early 19th century to today.

events.title: Dear America: Artists Explore the American Experience
events.description: What does it mean to be American? How have artists examined this question?

events.title: In the Library: Paper as Inspiration in Artists’ Books
events.description: Open weekdays, 11:00 a.m.–4:30 p.m.

events.title: Photography and the Black Arts Movement, 1955–1985
events.description: The first exhibition to consider photography’s impact on a cultural and aesthetic movement that celebrated Black history, identity, and beauty.

events.title: American Landscapes in Watercolor from the Corcoran Collection
events.description: Two centuries of watercolors capture the nation’s beauty from sea to shining sea.

events.title: Back and Forth: Rozeal., Titian, Cezanne
events.description: Spanning six centuries and different cultures, four paintings reveal how artists engage with art history—and become part of it.

events.title: In the Tower: Chakaia Booker: Treading New Ground
events.description: See three awe-inspiring sculptures by an American artist who transforms tires to explore environmental concerns.

events.title: The Stars We Do Not See: Australian Indigenous Art
events.description: Mark your calendar for this once-in-a-lifetime exhibition of modern and contemporary Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander art and design.
